resources.string: Manage your money and keep on top of your debt in just a few steps
Simply follow along with the guided set up process
Go to the Home Page to make income and spending entries, track your credit card transactions, and watch your weekly spending limits
MYnance will let you know how much money in your bank account is actually available for spending at any given time
MYnance will help you keep on top of your credit card spending so you avoid getting into consumer debt
Visit the \'Help\' section if you need more guidance
Click here to add another item
Okay, we\'ll ask you again later.
MYnance is a real-world app, so no tedious budgeting here. MYnance will help you make sure you\'re not over-spending or racking up debt.
To get started, you\'ll enter some quick estimates, but as you use the app, MYnance will update those numbers with actual data for more accuracy.
MYnance will use that info to reserve money in your main bank account to pay bills and let you know how much is left for you to spend on other things.
First, set up each of your sources of income separately in the following screen.
You\'ll tell us about your bills next. Bills are payments you regularly make.
Bills DO include items that are necessary living expenses (groceries, rent, insurance, etc.) and obligations (memberships, yearly vehicle registration costs, etc.).
Bills DO NOT include credit cards or savings. You\'ll set those up separately in another screen.
Bills also DO NOT include optional expenses or spending (entertainment, travel, clothing, gifts, etc.).
MYnance will help you make a debt repayment plan by calculating debt-free dates for each of your credit cards and lines of credit.
Set up each of your credit cards and lines of credit separately, even if you don\'t usually use them or owe any money on them.
Savings is any money that you set aside for any reason, whether it\'s short-term (to buy something in particular) or long-term (in case of emergency, for retirement, or for investment).
MYnance will help you make a savings plan by calculating the dates that you will achieve your savings goals.
Now that you\'ve entered all that info, MYnance can analyze your spending and flag any issues.
You\'ll have an opportunity to make adjustments, if necessary.
Ideally, shouldn\'t be using more than 80% of your income for living expenses.
of your income on living expenses.
You may want to make adjustments in one of the areas below.
You should try to make adjustments in one of the areas below.
Let you know how much of your money is available for unnecessary spending.
Organize your credit card purchases so you can pay them off quickly and avoid interest charges.
Watch your weekly spending in areas identified by you.
You don\'t have to use this feature to use the app, but you can identify existing or create new spending categories where you\'d like MYnance to keep an eye on your spending habits.
Remember, MYnance is completely secure because it\'s not linked to any outside websites or databases.
All your information is stored safely on your own device.
And you don\'t need to enter any bank account, credit card numbers, or PINs into the app.
You do need to let the app know how much money is in your main bank account today, so it can tell you how much of that money you can spend! Enter it below:
You can create as many expense categories as you like and identify them as either \"needs\" or \"optional\". MYnance will reserve money for all the \"needs\".
MYnance does it for you! As you use the app, it will continually update the numbers and reserve the right amount for paying your bills and alert you if you\'re spending more than you earn.
WARNING: You are spending more than you earn. Please CLICK HERE to fix it.
I want to track my spending on more than just my bills.
Where do I go to make a budget?
Did you want to change the default amount for this category?
Check the boxes below of the credit card purchases that you want to pay today.
Check the box when you\'re ready to start.
Choose categories below or create a new one.
Click here to get an analysis of your spending
click here to enter your debts
click here to enter your savings
Click here to set up weekly spending limits.
Contact us, we\'d love to hear from you!
This app is smart! When you overspend, it won\'t make money \"Available to Spend\" until you\'ve caught up on having enough money reserved for paying your bills.

The app will reserve the percentage of any money you put into your main bank account that you identified as being needed to pay your bills. Only the balance of your income will be \"Available to Spend\".
If you have overspent in the past, you may not have caught up on paying yourself back if you used money reserved for bills. The app is tracking this for you.

You can create a \"cash withdrawal\" category by making adjustments to \"Expenses\" in the \"Financial Summary\" or you can choose to record where every dollar of the cash withdrawal was spent against several categories.

MYnance believes the 2nd method will become tedious and is an unrealistic way to manage your money. You can use the \"Income and Expenses Report\" to identify if frequent cash withdrawals are a problem area for you.
MYnance believes that blind spending on credit cards leads to consumer debt. That is why we will alert you if you don\'t have the funds to cover your credit card purchases.
I put money into my account, but the \"Available to Spend\" amount is still zero.
It seems like the wrong amount is going into the \"Available to Spend\" amount.
The amount showing as the balance of my main bank account doesn\'t add up to the \"available to spend\" and \"reserved for bills\" amounts.
Why does MYnance give me spending warnings when I\'m using my credit card?
Either the interest is too high (debt) or too low (savings) or the payments are too low or too infrequent.
Why does the app tell me, \"Goal will not be achieved within your lifetime\"?
Congratulations! You\'re done setting MYnance up!
Will you please let us know what we need to change to make it better?
There are no email clients installed
Are you enjoying using this app?
How much do you usually pay each month?
What is the interest rate being charged?
How much do you already have saved for this?
What is the total amount you want to save?
How much money do you usually put towards this every month?
What is the annual interest rate being earned (if any)?
Click on a question to see its answer.
Name this card or line of credit
This expense is for needs (i.e. food, rent, insurance, etc)
You have no outstanding credit card purchases!
There is not enough credit available on this DEBTS item to make this transaction. You will be putting the debt over its limit.
There is not enough in this SAVINGS item to make this transaction. You will be putting the savings balance into the negative.
Oops, you are spending more than you make!
This expense is optional (i.e. entertainment, gifts, clothing, etc)
Pay these amounts to your credit cards:
You don\'t have enough money in your account to make this purchase. You will put your balance into the negative.
You don\'t have enough spending money left in your account to make this purchase. You will be spending money that is reserved for other expenses.
Will you please take a moment to rate it?
*if you need to enter a negative number, some keyboards require you to push the decimal button twice in order to get a minus sign in front of your number
Goal will not be achieved within your lifetime
No: This is an occasional expense and I don\'t need weekly guidance
Yes: I spend on this frequently and would like to be reminded of my limits
Do you want this category added to the WEEKLY LIMITS tab to help you stay within your spending limits?

(Reserved funds are reserved for bills, other living expenses, and any default payment amounts to credit cards/lines of credit or savings accounts. Ideally, this should not be more than 80% of your income.)
Add or remove the weekly watching feature to categories below or CLICK HERE to create a new category that you want MYnance to watch for you.
CLICK HERE to create a new category or choose one below
Move money into or out of accounts:
CLICK HERE to create a new credit card or choose one below
How much should come from your reserved funds?
How much should go into your reserved funds?
of the way to your goal!
Warning: You will not be able to delete or edit credit card payment transactions.
No entries in that date range
Your \"From\" date needs to be earlier than your \"To\" date
This purchase will put you over your weekly limit in this category.
You don\'t have enough money in your account to make this purchase. You will be accumulating a debt you can\'t afford.
You don\'t have enough money in your account to make this transfer. You will put your balance into the negative.
